basics.name: Daniel Ilies
basics.label: Software Engineer (AI/ML)
basics.summary: Software Engineer with 3 years of experience specializing in the development and deployment of machine learning solutions. Proven ability to build end-to-end AI systems, from Python/TensorFlow training pipelines to in-browser inference with TensorFlow.js, achieving over 90% detection accuracy in production. Experienced in LLM integration (OpenAI API), robotics simulation (NVIDIA Isaac Sim), and managing containerized ML infrastructure.

work.name: DevelBox
work.summary: Engineered production AI/ML systems, including a real-time ad detection model and an LLM-powered robotics controller, while managing the underlying containerized ML infrastructure.
highlights: Engineered AdCognition: an end-to-end ML ad detection system with a Python/TensorFlow training pipeline and a TensorFlow.js Chrome extension, achieving >90% detection accuracy.
Developed RoboGPT, an NVIDIA Isaac Sim extension using OpenAI APIs to control robots via natural language, reducing manual simulation inputs by ~30%.
Maintained and deployed Linux-based ML infrastructure using Flask, Docker, Nginx, and TensorBoard for model training, conversion, and serving.
Led frontend refactoring from Vue 2 to Vuetify, improving page load times by approximately 25%.

courses: Bachelor Thesis: Building a Modern Fullstack Web Application

projects.name: AdCognition – End-to-End ML Ad Detection System
projects.description: Production Chrome extension for real-time ad detection using a TensorFlow.js model, trained with a Python/CLIP-based pipeline and deployed via a containerized Flask service.
highlights: Achieved over 90% detection accuracy in production environments.
Built a full ML pipeline: Python/TensorFlow training -> TF.js conversion -> in-browser deployment.
Deployed and managed ML services using Docker, Nginx, and TensorBoard on a Linux environment.

projects.name: RoboGPT – LLM-Powered Robotics Control
projects.description: An extension for NVIDIA Isaac Sim enabling robot control through natural language commands, utilizing Large Language Models via the OpenAI API.
highlights: Reduced manual simulation inputs by ~30% by creating a natural language interface.
Integrated OpenAI's language models with a Python-based robotics stack to enable advanced control.

projects.name: MARS5 TTS Telegram Bot
projects.description: A Telegram bot that clones voices from audio files using the CambAI MARS5 Text-to-Speech API, demonstrating rapid integration of a third-party AI service.
highlights: Integrated a third-party AI API (CambAI MARS5) into a live, user-facing application.
Containerized and deployed the Python application using Docker.
